definition[0]: someone whose job is to calculate the value of something or the amount of tax someone should pay
definition[1]: someone who decides how well someone has done in an examination
definition[2]: someone who knows a lot about a subject or activity and who advises a judge or an official committee
definition[3]: someone whose job is to examine places, systems, or people to decide how good or suitable they are
example[0]: I worked for a travel agency as an assessor of foreign locations.
definition[4]: someone whose job is to assess the value of houses or other buildings to calculate how much tax the people who own them must pay
example[1]: It is the Regional Assessor who determines the tax band for the property.
definition[5]: a person or company whose job is to assess the value of loss or damage for someone who has made an insurance claim
example[2]: Her car was still in the garage waiting for a visit from the insurance assessor.
definition[6]: someone who helps a judge in a court of law by advising them on technical or scientific matters, or on other matters on which special knowledge is needed
